alert.note: Alert for Macon (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 03 at 11:18PM CDT until September 04 at 2:15AM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: The National Weather Service in Lincoln has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Macon County in central Illinois... * Until 215 AM CDT. * At 1116 PM CDT, local law enforcement reported flash flooding across the warned area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Numerous water rescues are in progress around the city. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Decatur and Harristown. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
